author: Liam Prenderville
title: Liverpool striker Divock Origi admits frustration at lack of opportunities - 'there are times you get down'
text:
Origi has largely been a substitute this term (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get     
Divock Origi has admitted his frustration at his role at Liverpool. 
The Belgian striker has been largely used as a substitute this term, having started just seven times in the Premier League. 
He has managed eight goals in those outings but Jurgen Klopp has often preferred to go without a recognised striker. 
While Origi is happy on Merseyside, he admits his confidence has dipped as a result of his lack of opportunities. 
"I believe in myself and I will get through but sitting on the bench, there are times that you get down," he told Het Nieuwsbald. Origi during training (Photo: Liverpool/Getty) Origi celebrates scoring (Photo: Liverpool FC/Getty Images) 
"All I can do is work hard. That is still the goal with Liverpool. That's my focus. 
"I can play in different positions, I do not see as a problem. But I still see myself as a striker." 
Ahead of Euro 2016, Origi was vying with Romelu Lukaku for a starting spot with Belgium, but the Everton striker is now comfortably winning the battle. Origi in action for Belgium (Photo: AFP/Getty) Everton's Romelu Lukaku celebrates (Photo: REUTERS) 
But the Liverpool hitman hasn't given up on emulating the striker on the other half of Merseyside. 
"I know what I can do. I play at a top club in Liverpool," he added. 
'Romelu is indeed doing well, because he works very hard and is focused on the right things. 
"I want the same progression as Romelu and I'm working for it." poll loading Does Divock Origi deserve more opportunities at Liverpool? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
